item.title: Bureau of Meteorology ordered to fix new website after torrent of complaints
item.description: Environment Minister Murray Watt tells the Bureau of Meteorology that its new $4.1 million website needs to be fixed after complaints from users.

item.title: Powerhouse seeks ideas for 100-year time capsule to be buried at Parramatta site opening
item.description: The Powerhouse Museum buried technologies such as a solar calculator and cardboard box camera in 1981. Now they want to know what to bury in 2026.

item.title: Dubbo's Carol Mudford wins AgriFutures Rural Women's Award
item.description: Carol Mudford's grassroots charity, sHedway, is dedicated to suicide prevention and positive mental health in the shearing industry.

item.title: World-first preterm birth prevention program has lowered the rate of early births by about 4,000 a year
item.description: A program introduced in Australia in 2018 has led to thousands of fewer babies born early each year, according to a new study.

item.title: Workers stood down from GFG Alliance Tahmoor coal mine expect hard times
item.description: Half the workforce at the Tahmoor Colliery in NSW has been stood down without pay, with workers and their families facing weeks of financial uncertainty.

item.title: Nine Queensland high schools taught wrong topic for external ancient history exam
item.description: Queensland's education minister has put authorities on notice after nine high schools taught year 12 students the wrong topic for today's ancient history exam.

item.title: Darwin wakes to shaking from magnitude-6.4 earthquake in Banda Sea
item.description: People across the Northern Territory's Top End woke to shaking in the early hours during a magnitude-6.4 earthquake in the Banda Sea near Timor-Leste.

item.description: Hughenden business owner Jodie Coward says she has not drank water straight from the tap in two years.

item.title: John Cleese leads tributes to 'perfect' on-screen wife Prunella Scales
item.description: Prunella Scales has been remembered as part of the golden era of British comedy for her numerous roles across film, TV and theatre.

item.title: Vietnam tourist sites submerged as record rainfall causes major flooding
item.description: Heavy rains cause major flooding in central Vietnam, while a category five hurricane rages on the other side of the world in the Caribbean.

item.description: Sam Kerr's coach and teammates aren't second-guessing the decision to re-install her as Matildas captain after returning to the field following a lengthy lay-off.

item.title: George Orwell's Animal Farm gets AI makeover as students learn about online influence
item.description: George Orwell's Animal Farm is being used to help high schoolers identify how AI can be used to influence opinion, build power and shape narratives.

item.title: Inflation data kills November rate cut chances as RBA faces headache
item.description: A November rate cut is dead, buried and cremated. It now looks far from certain that interest rates will fall again at all.

item.description: The AFL confirms the arrival of the last disposal rule as one of seven rule changes aimed at making umpires' jobs easier while shortening the length of games.

item.description: Residents of a small Victorian town hope a Tree of the Year award will save a beloved Algerian oak from being chopped down to make way for transmission lines.

item.description: Broken Hill resident Sid Siddall worries a lack of signage could result in emergency services being unable to find him the next time he needs urgent help.

item.description: A group of Tasmanian politicians opposed to the proposed Hobart stadium has failed to convince the AFL to abandon the contentious project during a meeting in Melbourne.

item.description: The death of an 80-year-old woman who was allegedly left on a remote tropical island after a cruise stop has reignited debate over passenger safety standards on the Great Barrier Reef.

item.title: 2025 Bournda Bird Olympics
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: What moving overseas for love and work looked like for Alex
item.description: Having recently ended a seven-year long-distance relationship, Alex Bowyer wasn't keen on repeating history when he met his now-boyfriend Tony in Japan. So he packed up his life and moved overseas — but not without a safety net.

item.title: Hundreds of jobs to go as AGL speeds up energy transition
item.description: AGL is preparing to shed hundreds jobs as part of a massive restructure aimed at freeing up capital to accelerate its transition away from coal and towards renewables.

item.title: Liberals hope for climate consensus but fear Nationals will dump net zero first
item.description: After most federal Liberal MPs attended a net zero meeting in Canberra, there is cautious optimism a consensus position can be found, but the junior Coalition partner could be poised to strike first.

item.title: Encrypted police group chat stops case against Canberra Raiders star Josh Papalii
item.description: Charges against Canberra Raiders prop Josh Papalii have been permanently stayed after it was revealed police had been discussing the case in a group chat on encrypted messaging service Signal.

item.title: NT government should proceed with Darwin ship lift project despite cost blowout, report finds
item.description: The NT government will gain no direct revenue from the ship lift project, despite spending $820 million on its construction.

item.title: Bureau of Meteorology reverts to previous rain radar after wave of complaints
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology says it will revert to its previous colour scheme on its rain radar and weather map following a wave of complaints about its new $4.1 million website.

item.title: Miners asked to reconsider using industrial explosives involved in underground explosion which killed two
item.description: Regulator may ban the type of explosive used in fatal mining accident which claimed the lives of two workers.

item.title: In pictures: Andrew's journey from favourite son to outcast prince
item.description: Prince Andrew has been stripped of his royal titles and removed from the Royal Lodge. Here's a photographic timeline of his scandalous downfall.

item.title: Large hailstones hammer parts of south-east Queensland as severe storms loom
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology issues a "very dangerous" thunderstorm warning for parts of south-east Queensland, with residents urged to prepare for supercell storms.

item.title: What do we know about Sandringham and Prince Andrew's new home?
item.description: The disgraced royal will be moving to a house somewhere on the sprawling Sandringham Estate owned by King Charles — but the exact location has not been made public.

item.title: Marnus Labuschagne happy to open in Australia's Test side for upcoming Ashes series
item.description: Marnus Labuschagne is prepared to do whatever it takes to get back into Australia's Test side, even if that means batting in a non-preferred opening slot.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Hailstorm across parts of Queensland
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Friday Finance with Daniel Ziffer
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Australia vs India second T20: Hazlewood and Marsh dominate in Melbourne
item.description: A lethal spell from Josh Hazlewood has propelled Australia to an emphatic four-wicket Twenty20 win over India in front of 82,438 fans at the MCG.

item.title: Australian climber dies on Nepal's Himlung Himal
item.description: An Australian mountaineer dies while descending one of Nepal's highest peaks.

item.title: NACC chief Paul Brereton steps away from all defence investigations
item.description: The head of the National Anti-Corruption Commission will step away from all defence-related corruption referrals following questions over his handling of perceived conflicts of interest.

item.title: Hurricane Melissa death toll continues rising as Caribbean nations embark on clean-up
item.description: The death toll in the wake of Hurricane Melissa has climbed to at least 49, according to official reports, after wreaking destruction across much of the northern Caribbean.

item.title: Dutch centrist leader Rob Jetten claims election victory and is set to become country's youngest PM
item.description: Dutch centrist party D66 is now expected to take the lead in a first round of talks to form a coalition government.

item.title: Albanese's salad days are stalked by the spectres of stagflation and soaring bills
item.description: The PM and his government are sitting in the often-fleeting sweet spot that comes early in the second term under our Westminster system of government.

item.title: The mystery of Prince Andrew's finances and why there are calls for more transparency
item.description: Andrew remains the subject of a mystery many are flummoxed by. The king's brother has not had a paid job for large chunks of his life, yet somehow he has managed to fund a luxury lifestyle.

item.title: Prince Andrew's downfall is Virginia Giuffre's justice, but can it save the monarchy?
item.description: Prince Andrew has been exiled to a kind royal house arrest but the jury is still out on whether it's enough to stem damage to the monarchy.

item.title: What does the average house price get you in regional Victoria?
item.description: The median house price in regional Victoria is $636,500. But what that will get you can look very different from place to place.

item.title: Older Australians say new aged care reforms will make them 'feel more imprisoned' after change in fees
item.description: Older Australians were promised "a world class aged care system", but as "once in a generation" changes roll out, some feel they are being delivered anything but.

item.title: Conjoined twins in PNG could be sent to Germany for surgery after Australia hopes fall through
item.description: The parents of conjoined twins in PNG who were hoping to send their babies to Sydney for an operation are now trying to go to Germany instead because Australia is too expensive

item.title: Zohran Mamdani's pledge to arrest Benjamin Netanyahu in NYC 'unenforceable campaign promise'
item.description: Zohran Mamdani, the man many predict will become New York City's next mayor, has made plenty of promises — his one to arrest Israel's PM is causing a particular stir ahead of Tuesday's election.

item.title: Nurse among patients calling for better access to long COVID treatment
item.description: Patients are calling for better access to long COVID care after the closure of one of the country's last public clinics.

item.title: Virginia Giuffre's brother demands Prince Andrew investigation, wants King to pressure Trump
item.description: Sky Roberts also appealed to King Charles to pressure Donald Trump into putting "big boy pants on" over the release of the Epstein files.

item.title: Survey reveals nine out of 10 NSW farmers are victims of crime
item.description: Widespread farm crime is frustrating rural communities, with almost 90 per cent of farmers in New South Wales reporting they have been victims.

item.title: Alcohol industry explores smaller packaging as consumers seek convenience
item.description: From wine in 187ml bottles to spirits in sleek aluminium cans, producers are downsizing to meet a growing demand for convenience and variety.

item.title: David McCormack on Bluey, Custard, and the power of popular music
item.description: From indie rock to children's TV icon, David McCormack has done it all — and now he's back with a new album and zero expectations.

item.title: Lawyers move to block Nauru deportations over lack of adequate healthcare
item.description: Human rights lawyers have applied to intervene in the High Court case of a man facing deportation to Nauru, arguing the government should be barred from deporting people to places where they face death or serious harm.

item.title: Master Builders Association of Victoria board member fails in legal bid to unmask purported whistleblower
item.description: A Master Builders Association of Victoria board member fails in their bid to identify the person who made a complaint about their conduct — provoking a colourful ruling from the presiding judge.

item.title: Potential tornadoes, giant hail forecast from supercell storms in eastern Australia
item.description: Australia's storm season shifts into top gear, and the next 72 hours will deliver a combination of rain, showers or thunderstorms to the eastern two-thirds of the country.

item.title: Why Australia's spring housing market this year is set to go into overdrive
item.description: NSW sees a 16.8 per cent increase in new property listings during spring — ringing true to the age-old saying this time of year is the best time to jump into the housing market.

item.title: North makes history with 24th consecutive AFLW win, Carlton finals-bound after win in the west
item.description: North Melbourne becomes the first male or female VFL/AFL team to win 24 consecutive games after prevailing over Hawthorn by 49 points.

item.title: Australia's pursuit of critical minerals holy grail could come at great cost

item.title: Alex de Minaur upset by Alexander Bublik again in Paris in repeat of Roland Garros heartbreak
item.description: Alex de Minaur suffers another nightmarish defeat in Paris at the hands of his old tormentor Alexander Bublik.

item.title: Trump wants to resume US nuclear weapons testing. This is what it could look like
item.description: The US has not conducted nuclear weapons testing for 33 years. Now Donald Trump is calling for a resumption, raising concerns about what that may involve.

item.title: Interest rates will fall again when inflation returns to target but that could require a painful adjustment
item.description: And until someone — redundant workers, big business, the RBA or government — foots the bill, interest rates are unlikely to budge from here.

item.title: Year 12 graduate Sea Sokra'a in a class of her own at Leinster
item.description: The close-knit community in one of Australia's last remaining company towns has celebrated the graduation of the only year 12 student from its remote school.

item.title: Usman Khawaja has seen politicians 'all over cricket', now he's joining other athletes to get action
item.description: Cricketer Usman Khawaja is one of the highest-profile Australian athletes who regularly wades into political issues. Now, Khawaja and other athletes have agreed to form a Players' Coalition to influence policy change on issues ranging from racism and human rights to social media abuse.

item.title: Trans people push to make healthcare more inclusive in the regions
item.description: A Queensland trans man says healthcare workers did not fully understand his needs when he sought fertility treatment.

item.title: Australia's childcare crisis forces us to reconsider how we organise care
item.description: This is not the first revelation about how we treat the most vulnerable in our society but such reports persistently reveal a deeper, and more distressing malaise about Australian society.

item.title: How the Lions conquered their growing pains to reach AFLW top four
item.description: After a shaky start to the season the Brisbane Lions showed faith in a shift in game style to climb up the ladder and guarantee themselves a top-four finish.

item.description: South-east Queensland faces a dangerous supercell outbreak on Saturday, with forecasters warning of giant hail, flash flooding and possible tornadoes.

item.title: Queensland Premier David Crisafulli admits there's a 'long way to go' on key issues after one year in office
item.description: In an interview with the ABC, David Crisafulli reflected on one year in power, reiterating the big four crises he campaigned on remain a priority.

item.title: Suzanne Rees died alone on Lizard Island. How did it happen?
item.description: Suzanne Rees joined a hike on Queensland's Lizard Island as part of a cruise stopover. She would never make it back to the boat.

item.title: Rome wasn’t built in a day – and neither was the Queensland school exam crisis
item.description: It didn't take long for news to spread that year 12 students in nine Queensland schools had been taught the wrong topic for their final ancient history exam, leaving teenagers "angry" about the "crazy" mistake.

item.title: Emergency doctors say RAH admitted more patients than bed limit, SA Health denies claim
item.description: The Australasian College of Emergency Medicine says on a day in September there were 70 admitted inpatients in the Royal Adelaide Hospital's emergency department that has 68 beds — a claim disputed by SA Health.

item.title: Many migrant woman facing having to 'start from scratch' in Australia but an employment program is trying to help
item.description: Migrant and refugee women often struggle to find employment upon arriving in Australia, even if they have experience and qualifications. A 14-week program is trying to help.

item.title: Holiday workers propping up key sectors exposed to serious workplace injuries
item.description: Many young people on the Working and Holiday Visa programs come to Australia to fill labour shortages in industries like meat processing and farming, but there are concerns around their health and safety in dangerous workplaces.

item.title: Open House southern midlands allows glimpse of life into Tasmania's Lonsdale Homestead
item.description: In Tasmania's southern midlands, Alan Townsend has spent the past two decades restoring an agricultural homestead with a history that dates back to the 1800s. This weekend, its doors will be open for people to visit.
